page.title: 12A BIT MIXED UP
page.content: {NICKNAMES}Tammy T, Pym, Barrel, Doodie, Dod or Pow and Wowp were local nicknames. These and many more are the result of intermarrying in families with the same surnames and so of the need to identify separately people with the same name {LANGUAGE}Fisher superstitions result in some words being banned and other words being used instead. Examples are pig(curly tail) rat(long tail) rabbit(fid) salmon(red fish). These banned words, like some of the names, were 'daurna mentions' (dare not mention) in local speech. {CUSTOMS}many old fishing customs have now gone. One is still seen. A flag on a house gate or in the garden means someone is to be married. Whoever puts the flag there gets a bottle of whisky from the bride or groom to be.
